intro: Asplundia ewanii, commonly known as the Ewan’s arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its tuberous rhizomes, which are used as a starchy food source. The plant produces striking, arrow-shaped leaves that can grow up to several feet in length. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe, typical of many arum species. Asplundia ewanii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
